definition: to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: It may be Spain's most short-lived public company.
sentences.chinese: 它可能是西班牙史上最短命的上市公司。

sentences.english: Spider-Man 3 is due to be released in May 2007.
sentences.chinese: “蜘蛛俠三”預計於2007年五月上市。

sentences.english: Analytic demonstration of the core competence of non-state-run listed enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 民營上市企業核心競爭力的實證分析。

sentences.english: No surprise, then, that motor manufacturers have been urging the EPA not to allow E15 on the forecourt.
sentences.chinese: 車商正催促環保局不要批准E15上市一點也不奇怪。

sentences.english: However, a recent two week India new flower market increased significantly.
sentences.chinese: 不過，最近兩週印度新花上市量明顯增加。

sentences.english: Related parties impropriate listed company lots of funds.
sentences.chinese: 關聯方佔用了上市公司較多資金。

sentences.english: Companies from the mainland accounted for 46 of the 66 new listings on the Hong Kong exchange this year.
sentences.chinese: 在香港新上市的66家企業中，有46家來自內地。

sentences.english: Telling Holding is keeping a quick growth with capital market.
sentences.chinese: 天音控股上市以來藉助資本市場保持了快速的發展。

sentences.english: Equity swap between shareholders of the listed company and shareholders of Huixin Futures.
sentences.chinese: 上市公司股東與匯鑫期貨股東進行股權置換。

sentences.english: Market-watchers had forecast the Link's share price would rise up to 10 per cent on its debut.
sentences.chinese: 市場人士原預期領匯股價會在上市首日升百分之十。

sentences.english: Analysts said that sentiment toward new deals in all sectors has soured in recent days.
sentences.chinese: 分析師說，近些天所有行業對於上市的態度都惡化了。

sentences.english: The strawberries have just come in.
That product is expected to become available next year, Mr. Kraemer said.
sentences.chinese: Kraemer先生表示，該產品將預計在明年上市。

sentences.english: Another was questioning wine enterprises Sue wine in A stock market not, do not see effect.
sentences.chinese: 另一家被約談的酒企蘇酒未在A股上市，影響暫未見。

sentences.english: Its paid-in capital is NT$1 billion or more at the time when it applies for listing.
sentences.chinese: 二申請上市時之實收資本額達新臺幣十億元以上者。

sentences.english: There may be stores that specifically make gift baskets listed in the phone book.
sentences.chinese: 可能有專門店在電話中作禮品籃上市書。

definition: to hit the market (of a new product)
to put sth on the market
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3
